data.title: Sam Mendes: movieland's king seeks a new queen after split
data.meta_description: Of all the towns in all the world to conquer Hollywood, Reading must be about the most improbable. Last week Tinseltown took its revenge in traditional fashion with the revelation that movieland’s
data.text:
Of all the towns in all the world to conquer Hollywood, Reading must be about the most improbable. Last week Tinseltown took its revenge in traditional fashion with the revelation that movieland’s Berkshire-born king and queen were no longer sharing a throne.

Sam Mendes, the director, and Kate Winslet, the actress — Oscar-winners both — got married in secret on an idyllic tropical island in 2003, with only three guests present. Last Monday their London lawyer let it be known that the couple had separated “earlier this year”.

The once media-friendly but now increasingly aloof couple were already on opposite sides of another continent — Mendes in New England, Winslet in Mexico. Rumours over the reason for the split have abounded, from suggestions that Winslet’s
